BikeSack

Class ConsoleDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • BikeSack.Display
      • BikeSack.ConsoleDisplay

  • public class ConsoleDisplay
extends Display
    ConsoleDisplay draws a text based representation of a motorcycle instrument cluster for the BikeSack system.

    A Map of Instrument objects is passed to ConsoleDisplay, which displays values based on the type of instrument (temperature, fuel, odometer etc.)

    Author:
    Ben Denford

    • Method Detail

      • show

        public void show(java.util.Map<BikeSack.INSTRUMENTS,Instrument> instruments)
        Print or refresh the console display with the updated values of all instruments passed to this display.

        For proper refresh and display, this class assumes a console height of 26 rows.

        Specified by:
        show in class Display
        Parameters:
        instruments - Map of all instruments in the BikeSack system that require display for the rider's information.
        See Also:
        BikeSack.INSTRUMENTS, Instrument

      • pad

        private java.lang.String pad(java.lang.String text,
                             int chars)
        Right Pads a string with supplied number of spaces.
        Parameters:
        text - String of text that is to be padded.
        chars - Int number of characters pad the string with.
        Returns:
        A string of text that is padded with spaces.

      • buildIndicator

        private java.lang.String buildIndicator(Instrument indicator)
        Visually displays the fade IN/OUT of the indicator based on the value of the instrument.
        Parameters:
        indicator - Instrument indicator that is to to output to the GUI.
        Returns:
        String representation of the indicator value in "*".
